title: 19th century magician posters
content:
![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131017093420im_/http:/typophile.com/files/56377009_eadc91e0af_3930.jpg)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131017093420im_/http:/typophile.com/files/56377196_8a5cf5783b_4771.jpg)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131017093420im_/http:/typophile.com/files/56377418_118fccce2e_5116.jpg)

I am curious on typefaces used in these old vintage posters, if anyone has any insight or similar font suggestions it would be greatly appreciated!

thank you
author: g4s

comments.content:
As a start, a good place to start would be [www.letterheadfonts.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20131017093420/http:/www.letterheadfonts.com/ "www.letterheadfonts.com") - you'll find lots of stuff there that fits into this time period.

JH
These are all hand lettered. JH makes a good suggestion. [Roxy](http://web.archive.org/web/20131017093420/http:/www.fontshop.com/search/?q=Roxy) has some similarities to the top poster lettering.
[MVB Magnesium](http://web.archive.org/web/20131017093420/http:/www.mvbfonts.com/html/fonts/magnesium/pk_magnesium.htm) also bears similarities to the incidental lettering in the top two.
